channel.title: sillygwailo tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from sillygwailo.

item.description:
It’s back! https://t.co/c38f0gedQq https://t.co/bdKbJCRK2X

The International Brotherhood of Boilermakers Local 128 are back with their DJ. https://t.co/msBQFtHsnl

It’s hard to imagine a Labour Day Parade trailer squeezing in more things that I love on it, but the Laborers' International Union of North America Labour Day Parade squeezed in a lot of them. https://t.co/iICaccw2C2

It wasn’t me wearing a hard hat and raising my left fist at the CN Tower, but it could’ve been me.

I walked along with the United Steelworkers float, in part because the DJ was playing reggae music, but also because it was the union my dad’s forest workers union merged with. https://t.co/7RsCPfBlTK

I always speed-run parades, and I don’t always stay till the end of them. For this year’s edition of the Toronto Labour Day Parade, I’ll never know if there was a rendition of “Union Strike Folk Song (Parts 1 & 2)” in the remaining floats. https://t.co/Bm82yaHE8w
item.source:markdown:
It’s back! https://t.co/c38f0gedQq https://t.co/bdKbJCRK2X
The International Brotherhood of Boilermakers Local 128 are back with their DJ. https://t.co/msBQFtHsnl
It’s hard to imagine a Labour Day Parade trailer squeezing in more things that I love on it, but the Laborers' International Union of North America Labour Day Parade squeezed in a lot of them. https://t.co/iICaccw2C2
It wasn’t me wearing a hard hat and raising my left fist at the CN Tower, but it could’ve been me.
I walked along with the United Steelworkers float, in part because the DJ was playing reggae music, but also because it was the union my dad’s forest workers union merged with. https://t.co/7RsCPfBlTK
I always speed-run parades, and I don’t always stay till the end of them. For this year’s edition of the Toronto Labour Day Parade, I’ll never know if there was a rendition of “Union Strike Folk Song (Parts 1 & 2)” in the remaining floats. https://t.co/Bm82yaHE8w

item.description: @rtanglao We have e-bikes in Toronto. I just have tried them yet. https://t.co/sXX73T34O7
item.source:markdown: @rtanglao We have e-bikes in Toronto. I just have tried them yet. https://t.co/sXX73T34O7

item.description:
Tonight. https://t.co/Rte220choI

No Method Man tonight. OK.

No Busta Rhymes either. They made a big deal about him joining the tour.

YDB, ODB’s son, is here rapping his father’s verses. That’s pretty cool.
item.source:markdown:
Tonight. https://t.co/Rte220choI
No Method Man tonight. OK.
No Busta Rhymes either. They made a big deal about him joining the tour.
YDB, ODB’s son, is here rapping his father’s verses. That’s pretty cool.

item.description: Covie is definitely ovie at the Canadian National Exhibition.
item.source:markdown: Covie is definitely ovie at the Canadian National Exhibition.

item.description: @DailyHiveTO The location at 370 King St. W. is open again! https://t.co/FyttluPYQI
item.source:markdown: @DailyHiveTO The location at 370 King St. W. is open again! https://t.co/FyttluPYQI

item.description:
Have you ever heard of a Starbucks closing permanently but then re-opening at the same location? That’s what happened at the 370 King St. W. location under the Hyatt Regency in Toronto. https://t.co/95jXOUzkTx

It was full of people, and I was the only one there wearing a mask, if you were wondering.
item.source:markdown:
Have you ever heard of a Starbucks closing permanently but then re-opening at the same location? That’s what happened at the 370 King St. W. location under the Hyatt Regency in Toronto. https://t.co/95jXOUzkTx
It was full of people, and I was the only one there wearing a mask, if you were wondering.

item.description: Extroverts in Toronto seem happy tonight.
item.source:markdown: Extroverts in Toronto seem happy tonight.

item.description: @rtanglao I haven’t done e-assist yet. I want to test it out first, i.e. not have somewhere I have to be, before choosing it at a bike share stall.
item.source:markdown: @rtanglao I haven’t done e-assist yet. I want to test it out first, i.e. not have somewhere I have to be, before choosing it at a bike share stall.

item.description: @rtanglao Coffee and donuts (I prefer the American spelling) at Lucky’s Doughnuts on Main and E. 13th. That’s still my favourite coffee shop of all time.
item.source:markdown: @rtanglao Coffee and donuts (I prefer the American spelling) at Lucky’s Doughnuts on Main and E. 13th. That’s still my favourite coffee shop of all time.

item.description: Not boring: Bullpen games, specifically the ones where a reliever starts a game, and the team purposely puts in each pitcher for no more than a few innings. It’s more democratic that way. https://t.co/uXM5JMHXzI
item.source:markdown: Not boring: Bullpen games, specifically the ones where a reliever starts a game, and the team purposely puts in each pitcher for no more than a few innings. It’s more democratic that way. https://t.co/uXM5JMHXzI

item.description: Oops, I got two beers deep for movie night tonight, which was cancelled. That means I'll do an “ask me anything” to pass the time.
item.source:markdown: Oops, I got two beers deep for movie night tonight, which was cancelled. That means I'll do an “ask me anything” to pass the time.

item.description: @collegeboy75 @dailysimpsons Because of this scene, I say that to myself every time I have to do something intricate but which I know I’m going to screw up.

item.description: The greatest athlete of all time. https://t.co/3jb4lz9yu5
item.source:markdown: The greatest athlete of all time. https://t.co/3jb4lz9yu5

item.description:
Tonight. https://t.co/CojRjTxdPU

I’m not the only ungroomed white man over 40 here.

The woman at the merch table didn’t know what Interac was. She must not be Canadian.

This is the first concert where I’ve seen abortion advice and Naxalone kits at the merch table. It was on the opening act’s side.

I wouldn’t call myself the biggest Animal Collective fan, but three songs in, and they justified my last-minute decision to attend their show. They’re very cool live.

“Consider the Balcony Seats the Next Time You Attend a Concert at the Danforth Music Hall” will be my title of my next post on my Substack.
item.source:markdown:
Tonight. https://t.co/CojRjTxdPU
I’m not the only ungroomed white man over 40 here.
The woman at the merch table didn’t know what Interac was. She must not be Canadian.
This is the first concert where I’ve seen abortion advice and Naxalone kits at the merch table. It was on the opening act’s side.
I wouldn’t call myself the biggest Animal Collective fan, but three songs in, and they justified my last-minute decision to attend their show. They’re very cool live.
“Consider the Balcony Seats the Next Time You Attend a Concert at the Danforth Music Hall” will be my title of my next post on my Substack.
